alert.note: Alert for Logan (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 21 at 5:25PM MDT until June 21 at 5:45PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: The National Weather Service in Denver Colorado has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southwestern Logan County in northeastern Colorado... * Until 545 PM MDT. * At 524 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Pawnee Pass, or 13 miles west of Sterling, and is nearly stationary. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Logan Corners around 540 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of this tornadic thunderstorm include Pawnee Pass. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
